title: Office squeeze and rent rises to come buoy Dexus
text:
Investors bought into the promise of an upside from Dexus, the country's largest office landlord, which is confident it can lift rents across a big chunk of its portfolio even higher as major corporate tenants feel the squeeze in Sydney and Melbourne.

The stock picked up 40¢, or 3.4 per cent, to close at $12.07 on Wednesday.

Dexus' Darren Steinberg Peter Braig

"This office market cycle is certainly not over, with our office portfolio effectively full and the Sydney and Melbourne office market vacancy rates at very low levels," chief executive Darren Steinberg said.

"In this environment we remain confident of being able to continue to drive rental growth in our quality office properties in these markets, particularly in those leases coming up for expiry over the next few years.”

Underpinning value in its office towers is the demand from offshore investors, some of whom Dexus will bring on board through its funds management business.
description: Australia’s office markets have been supported by the lack of oversupply, a boon for the country's largest office landlord, Dexus.
